newsitem.title: USA: U.S. urges citizens in Pakistan to be vigilant.
newsitem.headline: U.S. urges citizens in Pakistan to be vigilant.

text.p: The U.S. embassy in Islamabad, Pakistan issued a message warning U.S. citizens to be on alert for possible violence following the recent capture of a Pakistani accused of killing two people outside CIA headquarters four years ago.

The embassy said the recent capture of Mir Aimal Kansi, who has allegedly confessed to the January 1993 shooting spree that also wounded three others, has generated much publicity in Pakistan and the United States.

"The U.S. government has received no specific threat against any U.S. citizen living in Pakistan. However, we wish to remind U.S. citizens in Pakistan to remain vigilant," the embassy said in a statement released in Washington by the State Department.
Any concerns about security should be addressed to the U.S. embassy or consulates in Karachi, Peshawar or Lahore, the statement said.
